assignments.utilization_method: Place the tape roll flat on the table with its hole centred. Guide the bottle cap so it strikes directly onto the inner rim. The cap meets the rigid cardboard edge first (noticeable resistance), then slips suddenly through the hollow centre, causing the roll to tilt and the resistance to disappear—delivering a clean ‘break-in’ sensation similar to the rind finally splitting.

Stand the roll vertically like a small log. Bring the plush down onto the cut edge. The dense paper layers give a solid, resistive feel; as the force increases, the inner cardboard tube collapses slightly and sheets separate, letting the plush suddenly push through—providing that dramatic give-way of wood cracking.

physical_object.name: black stainless steel water bottle with 'TESLA' branding

assignments.utilization_method: Grip the narrow neck of the bottle (≈2–3 cm diameter) as though it were the mug handle, keeping the heavier body hanging below your hand.  This offset mass reproduces the mug’s forward roll when lifted.  Pitching the wrist 30–70° gives clear inertial resistance from the full bottle, simulating the sensation of tilting a full mug toward the mouth.

physical_object.name: green plush turtle shell with white rim

assignments.utilization_method: Clamp both hands around one edge of the plush shell and swing the opposite, padded bulk forward as the axe head.  The size and moderate weight offer noticeable inertia while the soft impact surface lets users safely practice the abrupt stop of a virtual chop.

physical_object.name: black and silver telescopic selfie stick with phone holder clamp

assignments.utilization_method: Extend the telescopic arm halfway and grip the rubberized handle at the bottom. The phone clamp on the far end concentrates mass away from your hand, giving a pronounced head-heavy feel. This length and weight distribution closely match the dynamics of a full-size claw hammer when swung.

Grasp only the right-hand grip of the controller in a power grip so that your knuckles point toward the opposite left grip. The single occupied grip becomes a short cylindrical handle while the bulk of the controller body overhangs forward, creating slight forward weight. Perform crescent-shaped pulling motions; the protruding left grip gives the sense of a curved blade leading the swing.
